FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

We keep records for all significant accidental chemical releases that occur at the facility. In the past five years, there have been no releases at the Neal Plant of any RMP regulated chemicals,  as addressed in 40 C.F. R. 68.42(a) as having an adverse impact on employees, the community, or the environment. If an incident governed by 40 C.F.R. 68.42(a) were to occur, we would conduct formal incident investigations designed to identify and address the root cause.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

We have developed and maintain an emergency response plan which includes planning and training elements for effectively protecting workers, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:
Braskem believes in a philosophy of continuous improvement. A number of programs are in place to monitor the status of ongoing efforts and continually seek opportunities to improve. The facility maintains a structured safety process as well as employee safety teams that meet regularly.

The Plant has not identified any changes to safety practices necessary to achieve or maintain compliance with any applicable regulatory standard since our last submission.  However,  as part of our efforts to continually improve safety at the Plant, Braskem is currently training site personnel on Human Reliability to increase focus on higher risk tasks and effective problem-solving across all work groups.

Braskem actively encourages participation by all employees in process safety management and provides relevant process safety information is available to employees. Employees participate in PHA revalidation studies and PHA studies consistent with our Management of Change Program.  Procedures provide the knowledge necessary for employees to perform their jobs safely and correctly.  Our employees and contractors are well trained, and they actively participate in the investigation of any incidents or accidents.  We engage experienced employees in developing and providing our training programs.  We also encourage employee suggestions for process safety improvement, and we regularly implement enhancements based on these suggestions.

As prescribed by our Management of Change procedure, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews are designed to ensure the safety of process operations following new installations or modifications. Our Mechanical Integrity Program includes written procedures governing the inspection and maintenance of affected process equipment. The Neal Plant has also developed and implements Hot Work Permit procedure to prevent performance of hot work in potentially dangerous areas. 

Through implementation of these multiple elements of our prevention program, the Plant minimizes accidental chemical releases. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:

At Braskem America, Inc. Neal Plant, we are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes in a safe and responsible manner. We use a combination of accidental release prevention programs and emergency response planning programs to help ensure the safety of our employees and the public as well as protection of the environment. This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented, including:

-A description of our Neal Plant and use of substances regulated by EPA's risk management program (RMP) regulation
-An overview of the Neal plant accident release prevention programs
-The five-year accident history for accidental releases of chemicals regulated by EPA's RMP rule
-An overview of our emergency response program
-An overview of the improvements made at the facility to minimize the potential for accidental chemical releases that could adversely affect our employees, public and the environment
-Certifications in accordance with RMP rule
-Relevant details information about the Neal plant's risk management program 

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES:

The Neal facility includes operations to produce polypropylene using a variety of chemicals, including RMP regulated substances.

Our accidental release prevention programs and contingency planning efforts help us effectively manage the hazards to employees, the public, and the environment posed by these chemicals.
